metas.title: Benchmarks & Web Statistics | Web Audits
metas.description: Detailed statistical analysis of the ECOS database. Compare web performance, sustainability, and security using percentiles, medians, and mean values.

body.md_1: This overview shows the statistical distribution of the performed audits. The database includes the ECOS total score as well as sub-categories and is updated daily.
body.md_2:
* **Mean:** The arithmetic average of all results.
* **Median (p50):** The exact middle – 50% of websites are better, 50% are worse.
* **Percentiles (p10 – p90):** These values help with classification. For example, if a URL reaches the **p90 value**, it belongs to the top 10% of all tested pages. Conversely, a value at **p25** means that 75% of the database performs better.

* The visualization as a violin and box plot shows the **distribution density**: the wider the shape, the more websites scored in that range. The box plot inside marks the middle 50% of the data, with the line representing the median. The outer lines (whiskers) show the spread of values from the p10 to the p90 percentile.

table_score_comparison.tsc_caption: Statistical distribution of the results of all audits in the ECOS database

statistical_violin_boxplot.title: Statistical distribution of audits
statistical_violin_boxplot.aria_label: Violin box plot diagram illustrating the distribution density and quartiles of all previous audit results in the database.
